pros: why is this review mandatory to see other incomes not fair

This organization stresses serving those in homelessness, poverty, and sex trafficking and extends the same grace and service to those of us working in the company. We try not to give to others what we're not willing and actively trying to do/give to one another. The benefits reflect an attitude of self-care for employees. The work is hard but the people that we get to work with make it easier.
cons: It would be nice for the company to offer a 401k

pros: They are great best company ever
cons: Nothing bad to say greT company

pros: Supportive Staff, good hours, open to ideas
This organization cares not just for the people that they are targeting to serve but also for team members/employees.
cons: It's in Lubbock so if smaller towns are not your thing, then it may not be the best fit.

pros: Camaraderie and community first, working alongside the client population and being able to be relational with client population, working hours/pay and benefits are a blessing when compared to other agencies.
cons: The only con I would say from witnessing new employees and new case managers enter the team is to sit more one on one with them to show the culture of Open Door and the expectations of Open Door culture or how Open Door likes for things to be done.

pros: great team; on the clock self care; great PTO & mental health days; meaningful work; justice oriented; diverse community; always growing & adapting; culture
cons: Experiencing trauma and walking alongside others through suffering can be heavy but also gain vicarious resilience

job_title: Community Center Director in Lubbock, TX
pros: Open Door in a wonderful place with a focused mission. The work here is fulfilling and life-giving.
cons: At times, can be a stressful ministry.

job_title: Coordinator Community Ministry Services in Lubbock, TX
pros: gives opportunity to give back and be a part of something that actually matters.

review_title: More than a job - a community on mission!
job_title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in Lubbock, TX
pros: The Open Door team is full of awesome people who care about each other, who practice self-care, value best-practices as well as innovation and creativity, are deeply invested in community development, are making an enormous impact, and who have fun doing it. I love this place - the people, culture, and the mission have kept me here and energized for 13+ years now.
cons:
Being deeply invested in community and relationship is hard. For people who aren't used to co-workers who share life together and practice vulnerability as a people, this can be really challenging. 

This is also really challenging work. We work with a community for which the crises of homelessness, trauma, mental illness, drug addiction, trafficking, and death are ever-present realities. Working at Open Door will challenge you, stretch you, and test your own personal stability. It's worth it and it requires lots of intentional self-care and growing, but it is challenging.

job_title: Permanent Supportive Housing Coordinator in Lubbock, TX
pros: Great culture. Great team. I can't believe I get to do this work in a great atmosphere.
cons: This is a small community with limited resources.
